meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Annette Todd David Gard Patrick Morrison Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6325.

td.p: Annette Todd, a marketing director from Riverside, California
David Gard, a retail horticulturist from Jamaica Plain, Massachusetts
Patrick Morrison, a student of Slavic Studies from Northville, Michigan (whose 3-day cash winnings total $80,701)

tr.td: EMILY DICKINSON
2 BY 2
(Alex: You have to name the pop duo.)
MEMPHIS
ANNUAL EVENTS
ASTRONOMY
"V" ME

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Annette, you\'re smiling much too much on this Final as we look for a book villain. What did you write down?)
(Annette: I just put down "Hanibal". I know the movie. I just can\'t remember the guy\'s name. [Laughs])
(Alex: No. We can\'t accept that. no. Sorry. You were on the right track, though.)
...
(Alex: [Revealing Patrick\'s answer] That\'s it, yes. Silence of the Lambs, Red Dragon.)
AnnetteWho is Hanibal Le
$2,998
PatrickWho is Hannibal Lecter?
$8,000
DavidWho is Hannibal Lechter?
$13,300
Hannibal Lecter')

tr.td: BOOK VILLAINS
The first time we meet this man in a 1981 novel, he's in his cell holding "Le Grand Dictionnaire de Cuisine"
Patrick
David
Annette
2nd place: $2,000
New champion: $29,300
3rd place: $1,000
Patrick
David
Annette

19 R,
1 W
(including 1 DD)

21 R
(including 2 DDs),

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
